items.title: Tests with feature=std fail to compile
items.body:
Hi, 

I've only a rudimentary understanding of Rust, but this library has me curious and I'm tinkering around to understand it better. 

I can build the package fine. Though when I 'cargo test' it just reports back:
```
running 0 tests

test result: ok. 0 passed; 0 failed; 0 ignored; 0 measured; 0 filtered out

    Doc-tests fleetwood

running 0 tests 

test result: ok. 0 passed; 0 failed; 0 ignored; 0 measured; 0 filtered out
```
Perhaps I'm just limited by my own knowledge here, but I liked the ERC20 and simple add contracts in the tests at the bottom of lib.rs, and wanted to experiment. 

active toolchain:
nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu (default)
rustc 1.33.0-nightly (e2f221c75 2019-01-15)

misc info:
Ubuntu 18.04, vim 8

Reading the two blog posts linked at the top of the library I remember it was explained that this worked out of the box with RLS and immediate feedback local testing so I tried Visual Studio code + RLS to no avail either. 

Thanks
